Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder section of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink and remains of two parallel lines of cord-marked decoration.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394331) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394331)
